intro: Hesperonia californica subsp. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved hesperonia, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological features compared to other hesperonia species.
